rules_or_instructions: Follow the line clearance system before starting the operations as per respective SOP PAP-QA-002.
Follow the current good manufacturing practices.
Follow the approved Standard Operating Procedures.
Ensure that Personnel are trained for the allocated job.
When you document, ensure that the entry is correct and legible. If any discrepancy or mistake is observed during documentation, correct as per SOP No. IR-QA-002.
Ensure that plant utility, RLAF, LAF and AHU units are in running condition.
Read the manufacturing instructions before proceeding with operations and follow it and document each operation in BMR.
Ensure that all required RM and PPM are approved.
Follow entry-exit procedure into respective area as per SOP No. PAP-SM-001 and PAP-SM-002.
Ensure the environmental condition %RH, Temperature and Differential pressure are within limit.
In case additional pages are required, get the same issued from QA and attach.
Attach all dispensing labels / in process weight printouts on Exhibit-VIII (Page for Pasting Labels/ Printouts) as per SOP No. PAP-SM-054 and attach with BMR.
Before signature at specified place, follow the responsibility as per below.
Review the Audit trail of equipment's as per SOP No. IR-MF-001
Doer: A person who perform the activity or gets things done with efficiency according to procedure.
Done by: Signature of person actually doing the operation, test, inspection, calculation etc. being recorded.
Checked by: The person responsible for observing the actual procedure or witnessing performance of the task or performing an independent check to ensure the task was done correctly.
Verified by: A person who ensure or demonstrates that activity performed by doer is true, accurate or justified.
Reviewed by: Signature of the person responsible for reviewing and examining the documentation certifying that the record/protocol/report has been reviewed and found completed and in compliance.
Ensured by: The person responsible for ensuring the procedure or witnessing performance of the task or performing an independent check to ensure the task was done correctly.
Ensure that preventive maintenance, Qualification of equipment's and calibration of instruments are within due date.

rules_or_instructions: GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS
Store the bulk solution under nitrogen blanketing (if applicable).
Product Specific Instruction:
Nitrogen gas to be used as inert gas for filtration purpose.
Store the bulk solution in a closed SS vessel between 15°C to 25°C.
The maximum pressure for 1st and final filtration should not more than 2.5 bar.
Bubble point determination should be carried out at 20-25°C.
Terminal sterilization parameters: NLT 121°C for NLT 15 minutes.
Dispense required quantity of Hydrochloric Acid IP in glass container with suitable capacity.

<::The image displays a process flow diagram titled "5.0 PROCESS FLOW DIAGRAM". The diagram is organized into sequential steps, with materials and processes flowing from top to bottom and across, grouped into two main areas. **BATCH PREPARATION AREA** (indicated by a vertical bracket on the right): * The process starts with "MATERIALS ISSUANCE". * From "MATERIALS ISSUANCE", paths lead to "RAW MATERIALS", "TWIST OFF PORT", "POLYPROPYLENE TUBE ROLL", "POLYPROPYLENE FILM ROLL", and "HOT STAMPING FOIL". * "RAW MATERIALS" feeds into "RM. DISPENSING". * "TWIST OFF PORT" feeds into "PPM. DISPENSING". * Both "RM. DISPENSING" and "PPM. DISPENSING" feed into "MANUFACTURING". * From "MANUFACTURING", the flow goes to "IN PROCESS TESTING OF UNFILTERED BULK". * A feedback loop exists from "IN PROCESS TESTING OF UNFILTERED BULK" back to "MANUFACTURING". * "HOT STAMPING FOIL" feeds into "THERMAL TRANSFER PRINT RIBBON". **FILTRATION AND FILLING AREA** (indicated by a vertical bracket on the right): * From "IN PROCESS TESTING OF UNFILTERED BULK", the process moves to "FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH PRIMARY FILTER". * From "FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH PRIMARY FILTER", the flow goes to "FILTRATION VESSEL". * From "FILTRATION VESSEL", the flow proceeds to "IN PROCESS TESTING OF FILTERED BULK". * A feedback loop exists from "IN PROCESS TESTING OF FILTERED BULK" back to "FILTRATION VESSEL". * From "IN PROCESS TESTING OF FILTERED BULK", the process moves to "FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH FINAL FILTER". * The following materials feed into "BAG MAKING, PRINTING, FILLING, STOPPERING": * "POLYPROPYLENE TUBE ROLL" * "POLYPROPYLENE FILM ROLL" * "THERMAL TRANSFER PRINT RIBBON" * From "FILTRATION OF BULK SOLUTION THROUGH FINAL FILTER", the flow goes to "BAG MAKING, PRINTING, FILLING, STOPPERING". * From "BAG MAKING, PRINTING, FILLING, STOPPERING", the process moves to "IN PROCESS TESTING OF FILLED BAGS". * From "IN PROCESS TESTING OF FILLED BAGS", the process moves to "TERMINAL STERILIZATION". * The final step shown is "FINISHED PRODUCT SAMPLING" after "TERMINAL STERILIZATION". : flowchart::> <::attestation: [Official Stamp] [Status: superseded] [Readable Text: SUPERSEDED COPY] A red rectangular stamp with the text "SUPERSEDED COPY" centered within it, indicating the document is no longer current or valid.::>

rules_or_instructions: 13.0 PREPARATION FOR MANUFACTURING
LOOP NUMBER DETAILS.

rules_or_instructions: 19.0 FILLING LINE PROCESS
Perform the Air volume of Bags as per below procedure as per SOP No. PAP-SM-056.
Take a syringe with appropriate capacity as per requirement based on filled volume.
Ensure the plunger is properly fixed inside the syringe barrel.
Ensure the plunger tip is pushed up to the barrel tip so that there is no air present inside the syringe
Fix the needle with syringe.
Hold a container vertically in hand and make sure that bottom surface as well as body of the container shall not touch to any surface.
Insert the needle inside the sealed unit through injection port care and tube portion.
Ensure the needle should not touch into liquid present inside sealed unit and inner surface of container
Now gently draw headspace air present inside the sealed unit by pulling the plunger until liquid shall entering inside the syringe.

## 19.0 FILLING LINE PROCESS Perform the Air volume of Bags as per below procedure as per SOP No. PAP-SM-056. * Take a syringe with appropriate capacity as per requirement based on filled volume. * Ensure the plunger is properly fixed inside the syringe barrel. * Ensure the plunger tip is pushed up to the barrel tip so that there is no air present inside the syringe * Fix the needle with syringe. * Hold a container vertically in hand and make sure that bottom surface as well as body of the container shall not touch to any surface. * Insert the needle inside the sealed unit through injection port care and tube portion. * Ensure the needle should not touch into liquid present inside sealed unit and inner surface of container * Now gently draw headspace air present inside the sealed unit by pulling the plunger until liquid shall entering inside the syringe. * The points at which liquid starts entering inside the syringe is end point of headspace in air measurement. * Now observed the reading in syringe and record the approx. air volume (in mL) in Below table <::attestation: Stamp Status: Superseded copy Readable Text: SUPERSEDED COPY A rectangular red stamp with the text "SUPERSEDED COPY" centered within it, appearing on a white background. ::>
